caption:
This photograph features a fishing rod and reel set up on a flat concrete surface by the water. The rod is supported by a rod holder, which appears to be clamped onto the concrete surface. A rock is strategically placed on the base of the rod holder, likely to add stability. The fishing rod is bent slightly, indicating either the weight of the bait or a slight pull from the water. There's a bell attached near the tip of the rod, often used to signal when a fish is biting.

In the background, the water of a lake or river is visible, suggesting that the setting might be near a large body of freshwater. The reflection on the water glitters under the sunlight, indicating it might be a bright sunny day. The focus and composition center on the fishing gear, showcasing it in clear detail against the blurred natural backdrop, emphasizing a sense of calmness and patience typically associated with fishing.
title: "Lazy man fishing" at Cascade Locks on the Columbia River
